intro: Facheiroa chaetacantha var. montealtoi, commonly known as the Monte Alto facheiroa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a woody stem that supports its compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
